forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. Southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 67, with temperatures falling to around 65 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
In the early hours of this Friday, Downtown San Francisco awakens under a partly cloudy sky, enveloped in a gentle breeze that drifts in from the southwest. The air is cool, with temperatures hovering around a comfortable fifty-four degrees, hinting at the warmth that the day will eventually bring. As the sun prepares to rise, a soft glow begins to stretch across the horizon, suggesting that today will be one of those precious California days where the sun graces the city with unembellished brilliance. 

By midday, expect the clouds to part completely, allowing the sun to shine brightly down, warming the streets to a pleasant sixty-seven degrees. As the afternoon unfolds, temperatures may dip slightly, settling around sixty-five, but not before the sun casts a golden hue across the cityscape. The gentle wind, with its slight, invigorating gusts, will accompany anyone stepping out to explore. While likely remnants of the morning’s marine layer may still cling to certain corners—particularly near the coast—these will not detract from the clear views and vibrancy of a day spent outdoors. To make the most of this splendid summer day, lighter layers will be ideal; consider donning a comfortable shirt paired with a light jacket that may be shed as the sun warms the afternoon. Perhaps a stroll along the waterfront, stopping for a quiet moment with a coffee at a local café, or wandering through the city’s parks will perfectly complement the delightful weather.
